channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Midair collision involving 2 helicopters in New Jersey leaves 1 dead, 1 injured
item.description: A midair collision involving two helicopters in Hammonton, New Jersey, killed one person and critically injured another, federal authorities say.
item.content:encoded: A midair collision involving two helicopters in Hammonton, New Jersey, killed one person and critically injured another, federal authorities say.
item.dc:creator: Frank Langfitt

item.title: Ex-Pentagon official on the prospects of a peace deal between Ukraine and Russia
item.description: Ukraine's president visited Mar-a-Lago Sunday. NPR's Leila Fadel talks to former Pentagon official Evelyn Farkas, now executive director of the McCain Institute, about prospects for peace.
item.content:encoded: Ukraine's president visited Mar-a-Lago Sunday. NPR's Leila Fadel talks to former Pentagon official Evelyn Farkas, now executive director of the McCain Institute, about prospects for peace.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Trump says there's progress on a peace deal between Ukraine and Russia
item.description: President Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy say they are making progress on a peace deal to end the war in Russia after meeting in Mar-a-Lago Sunday.
item.content:encoded: President Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy say they are making progress on a peace deal to end the war in Russia after meeting in Mar-a-Lago Sunday.
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: Teens are having disturbing interactions with chatbots. Here's how to lower the risks
item.description: Teen use of AI chatbots is growing, and psychologists worry it's affecting their social development and mental health. Here's what parents should know to help kids use the technology safely.
item.content:encoded: Teen use of AI chatbots is growing, and psychologists worry it's affecting their social development and mental health. Here's what parents should know to help kids use the technology safely.
item.dc:creator: Rhitu Chatterjee

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Trump says progress is being made on a deal between Ukraine and Russia, Israeli prime minister to meet with Trump Monday, anti-poverty groups are bracing for what lies ahead after a year of chaos.
item.content:encoded: Trump says progress is being made on a deal between Ukraine and Russia, Israeli prime minister to meet with Trump Monday, anti-poverty groups are bracing for what lies ahead after a year of chaos.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Many farmers are going into 2026 on the brink
item.description: President Trump says 2026 will be better for American farmers, thanks in part to $12 billion in new federal "bridge payments." But optimism remains hard to come by in farm country.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump says 2026 will be better for American farmers, thanks in part to $12 billion in new federal "bridge payments." But optimism remains hard to come by in farm country.

(Image credit: Kirk Siegler)
item.dc:creator: Kirk Siegler

item.title: New report reveals the role of U.S. jets in global drug trafficking
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep asks investigative journalist Jonny Wrate about the role of U.S. jets in global drug trafficking, in light of a new report by the Organized Crime and Corruption Reporting Project.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep asks investigative journalist Jonny Wrate about the role of U.S. jets in global drug trafficking, in light of a new report by the Organized Crime and Corruption Reporting Project.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Book distributor shutting down deals logistical blow to libraries
item.description: Baker and Taylor is one of very few companies that do book-distribution for libraries — companies that act as the middle man between libraries and publishers. But a few months ago, the company abruptly announced it was shutting down.
item.content:encoded: Baker and Taylor is one of very few companies that do book-distribution for libraries — companies that act as the middle man between libraries and publishers. But a few months ago, the company abruptly announced it was shutting down.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: A top chef weighs in on recipe ideas for the Kwanzaa table
item.description: The weeklong celebration of Kwanzaa is a perfect opportunity to revisit soothing, hearty winter foods, says celebrity chef Tanya Holland.
item.content:encoded:
The weeklong celebration of Kwanzaa is a perfect opportunity to revisit soothing, hearty winter foods, says celebrity chef Tanya Holland.

(Image credit: Aubrey Pick)
item.dc:creator: Anastasia Tsioulcas

item.title: Tennessee Williams' radio play 'The Strangers' published for the first time
item.description: A previously unpublished radio play written by Tennessee Williams as a college student has been published in The Strand magazine. What does the work say about the playwright before he became famous?
item.content:encoded: A previously unpublished radio play written by Tennessee Williams as a college student has been published in The Strand magazine. What does the work say about the playwright before he became famous?
item.dc:creator: Hosts
